content: Ten Sad Signs Your Writing is Web-Influenced Moz News By: Rebecca Kelley October 13, 2006 The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. Table of Contents Copied! By: Rebecca Kelley October 13, 2006 Ten Sad Signs Your Writing is Web-Influenced Moz News The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. For a little Friday fun, I came up with ten sentences you may read in an email from someone whose writing has clearly been influenced by the Web: "I really digg that noob girl that Accounting hired." "Whoever pwns a blue Dodge Stratus needs to move his car because it's parked next to a hydrant." "Did you notice the lights flickring yesterday?" "Thanks for inviting me to dinner Friday night. The lasagna you made was del.icio.us." "FYI: I'll be in late on Wednesday because I've got an eye doctor's appointment to get my site checked." "I gotta come in and do some spring cleaning this weekend--MySpace at the office is getting a bit cluttered." "The art museum is featuring a Picasa exhibit. I was thinking of checking it out." "Did you watch the Tigers game last night? They pulled off a close one ftw." "I'm not sure when I'll be able to stop by, but I'll AIM to be there by eight." "I'm planning to make a lot of food for the party, so I'd really appreciate it if you could come over early and mashup the potatoes while I prep the turkey." The death of the written word, ladies and gentlemen! Sigh... Copied! Back to Top
